result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J. Kraus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy J. Kraus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:35 PM: Defendant Timothy J. Kraus in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement recited by DA.  Def and consel concur w/State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea w/o Repeater:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement prior to sentencing by SPD.  No statement by Def personally.  The Court:  Will accept resolution.  90 days WCJ - I/S - S/W - 1 yr probation - concurrent to any existing supervision - currently on ES.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; No DNA Sample - previously provided; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD-Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi states matter can be scheduled for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Case Re-Called @ 1:25 PM: Defendant Timothy J. Kraus in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  After meeting with Def and assuming conflict check turns out fine, Def will be eligible for SPD services.  Court withdraws warrant in light of counsel issue being resolved.  STC scheduled - NOH given.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 09:15 am.

9:08 am case called. Defendant Timothy J. Kraus in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions the defendant regarding counsel. Defendant states he was appointed an attorney. Court questions defendant further regarding appointment of counsel. Defendant states he qualifies for appointment of counsel and is unsure why the attorney is not here. Statement by the court-defendant is directed to wait in the hallway until Attorney Szilagyi is here to discuss the matter with him. Court requires the defendant to return to court at 1:00 pm today to discuss eligibility for SPD.

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy J. Kraus
Current: PO Box 554, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States  (Effective: 11-09-2015)
Prior: 101 W. Main Street Apt. #b, Wautoma, WI 54982
From defendant requesting voluntary appearance. Court grants request

3:31 pm case called. Defendant Timothy J. Kraus not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non-appearance of the defendant Court orders a warrant-State of Wisconsin.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:18 PM: Defendant Timothy J. Kraus in court, in custody, appears pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  ADA serves Complaint - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and has not spoken with SPD.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility.  NGP entered by Court.   Signature Bond ordered as Def serving sanction SEH in WCJ.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 03:05 pm.
